"This one is of Wisp and Will, and has her mind concluded. While this one is but flesh and fur, and is the more deluded."
There are somethings worse than death. Ask Willow.
There once was born a very beautiful dragon. One of the very first.
At and early age she had a fear of death. When her mother assured her she was biologically immortal, and would almost certainly live for centuries, she only became more terrified
as it meant unlike other creatures with finite lives, when she died, she would have missed out on infinite potential.
Huh, an immortal dragon with a midlife crisis.
The things we do in fear
So she looked for ways to keep herself safe. She hid herself away and eventually found safety and power when she started feeding on black magic.
Ooh. I like necromancy with unusual reasoning!
Instead of going out herself, she used her shapeshifting to split parts of herself off, while her main body remained safe.
At first only a little at a time, but then more and more over the years
okay I gotta go eat dinner now brb

Over time she resembled less and less of a dragon, and began losing her sanity as she tore herself into more and more pieces every time she grew, eventually becoming the source of the fey in the forest.
